content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun, and easy to solve it in 5 minutes.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun challenge with basic structures.
Personally I think that this clash is a bit too hard mainly because of how fiddly it is to get the spaces right and format it correctly. Slightly simplifying it might help.
Oh no, I forgot to time myself when working on this – but I grasped the idea very quickly and the difficulty really isn't too high. I think this will be a great clash for all modes!

Minor remark: add to the example that it concerns [[w]]=[[h]]=2.

I do like the clash, it is indeed nicely visual. I just managed it in around 5 minutes (but I had some extra minutes of thinking while I checked it as reverse case), only I just lost a bit of time wondering whether w=2 includes or excludes the borders. Adding the info to the example will solve that.

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: Too long, it's complicated to code perfectly that in 5 minutes but it's a nice idea !
Very visual, which makes it fun!

Goal section
* Please format h and w as [[variables]].

* Please delete "At the end of each line there is a \n". Including "\n" in the string to print is not necessary for some programming languages.

* Please change "Ex" to "Example".

* For illustration of the cone, you may use the ```multiline format``` (3 backticks at the beginning and at the end of the text).

* More explanation is required for the characters that should be used for each part of the rocket.

* "depends on" is too vague. Please explain a bit more.

Input section
* Suggest to rewrite the whole section as follows:
<<Line 1:>> Two space-separated integers [[w]] and [[h]] for the width and height of the rocket respectively

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement (e.g. "write answer", or "write rocket").

By the way, the rocket looks a bit off when width is an odd number.

Thanks.

Thank you for your suggestions, all of which are on point.
h and w are now formatted as variables.
\n at the end of each line is a necessity, because some would think that there are as many spaces at the end as in the beginning, but there are really not.
```multiline format``` is a great addition
I think the explanations are fine now, as well as the addition to "depends on"

Thank you for your reply and making the changes. Below are the comments based on the revised version:

Goal section
* I understand your rationale behind mentioning "\n" now. Normally we do not mention that, and instead, a note is added to ask the player to trim all trailing space characters in each line of output.

* Please explain that the cone always starts with a width of 2, and in each subsequent line, 2 space characters are added between {{/}} and {{\}} until the width of the cone is [[w]].

* Please explain that the body has a height of [[h]] and a width of [[w]]. The left and right sides of the body are represented by {{|}}, and the middle are filled with space characters.

* Please explain the flames are filled with {{X}} instead of space characters.

Input section
* Please change w to h, h to w, width to height, and height to width. (I think I followed your original wording and that was actually inconsistent with the stub generator.)

Thanks again :)

I am once again grateful for your valuable input!
I encourage you to continue helping the community the same way you help me!
